law.catch_line: Special rules for apportioning business income -- Management of a treasury function -- Passenger airlines -- Qualified air freight forwarders.

text.section:
If a corporation holds liquid assets in connection with one (1) or more treasury functions of the corporation, and the liquid assets produce business income when sold, exchanged, or otherwise disposed of, the overall net gain from those transactions for each treasury function for the tax period shall be included in the sales factor. For purposes of this subsection:
Each treasury function shall be considered separately; and
A corporation principally engaged in the trade or business of purchasing and selling instruments or other items included in the definition of liquid assets is not performing a treasury function with respect to that income produced.

For purposes of apportioning business income to this state:
Passenger airlines shall determine the property, payroll, and sales factors as follows:
Except as modified by this subparagraph, the property factor shall be determined as provided in KRS 141.120(8)(a). Aircraft operated by a passenger airline shall be included in both the numerator and denominator of the property factor. Aircraft shall be included in the numerator of the property factor by determining the product of:
The total average value of the aircraft operated by the passenger airline; and
A fraction, the numerator of which is the Kentucky revenue passenger miles of the passenger airline for the taxable year and the denominator of which is the total revenue passenger miles of the passenger airline for the taxable year;
Except as modified by this subparagraph, the payroll factor shall be determined as provided in KRS 141.120(8)(b). Compensation paid during the tax period by a passenger airline to flight personnel shall be included in the numerator of the payroll factor by determining the product of:
The total amount paid during the taxable year to flight personnel; and
A fraction, the numerator of which is the Kentucky revenue passenger miles of the passenger airline for the taxable year and the denominator of which is the total revenue passenger miles of the passenger airline for the taxable year; and
Except as modified by this subparagraph, the sales factor shall be determined as provided in KRS 141.120(8)(c). Transportation revenues shall be included in the numerator of the sales factor by determining the product of:
The total transportation revenues of the passenger airline for the taxable year; and
A fraction, the numerator of which is the Kentucky revenue passenger miles for the taxable year and the denominator of which is the total revenue passenger miles for the taxable year; and
Qualified air freight forwarders shall determine the property, payroll, and sales factors as follows:
The property factor shall be determined as provided in KRS 141.120(8)(a);
The payroll factor shall be determined as provided in KRS 141.120(8)(b); and
Except as modified by this subparagraph, the sales factor shall be determined as provided in KRS 141.120(8)(c). Freight forwarding revenues shall be included in the numerator of the sales factor by determining the product of:
The total freight forwarding revenues of the qualified air freight forwarder for the taxable year; and
A fraction, the numerator of which is miles operated in Kentucky by the affiliated airline and the denominator of which is the total miles operated by the affiliated airline.

law.history: Amended 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 101, sec. 2, effective April 11, 2012. -- Created 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 18, sec. 3, effective July 15, 2008.

metadata.lrc-note: (4/11/2012). 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 101, sec. 3, provides that this statute, as amended by 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 101, sec. 2, "applies to taxable years beginning on or after January 1, 2010." (7/15/2008). 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 18, sec. 4 provides that this section "shall apply to taxable periods beginning after December 31, 2007."
